sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 5
sermons.description: Why does God allow temptation to come?  Behind the first temptation of the devil was this false grace to comfort people in their sin, whereas every word from God is a challenge to deliver from sin.  Satan still seeks to lead Christians away from simple devotion to Christ, which is simple obedience to what God has said.
sermons.preacher_description:
Zac Poonen ( - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Zac Poonen in mp3 format. God called brother Zac Poonen to a new work early on in his Christian experience. The movement is now called Christian Fellowship Churches where the New Covenant of New Testament Christianity is clearly preached. 

Brother Zac Poonen has written 25 books most of them being on the deeper Christian life. Many of these have been translated into a number of languages and have been circulated widely around the world. He clearly and passionately shares the  narrow way of Christian discipleship that is neglected by so many modern preachers.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 6
sermons.description: "There is always hope in God's rebuke," says Zac Poonen, as he points out how hard work is a protection and the priorities of wife and mother are the marks of a spiritual woman.  The first prophecies of Scripture contain the defeat of Satan and Christ manifest in the flesh as well as His death, taking upon Himself all the curse of Genesis 3--sorrow, sweat, thorns, dust, sword and death.
sermons.preacher_description:

sermons.title: (Genesis) 9 - The Sting of Death and the Seed of the Woman
(Genesis) Genesis 3 Introduction
sermons.preacher_description:
J. Vernon McGee (1904 - 1988)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker J. Vernon McGee in mp3 format. Brother McGee pastored an inter-denominational church, Church Of The Open Door in California. In 1967 he started the now famous "Through The Bible" radio program that airs on thousands of stations world-wide.

His burden has been to do systematic simple bible teaching to equip believers, protect them against false doctrines and share the whole counsel of God. He also has been a guest lecturer at the Dallas Theological Seminary.

sermons.title: (basics) 4. Sin Comes From Unbelief
sermons.preacher_description:
Zac Poonen ( - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Zac Poonen in mp3 format. God called brother Zac Poonen to a new work early on in his Christian experience. sermons.title: 13. Did our first parents continue in the estate wherein they were created?
15. What was the sin whereby our first parents fell from the estate wherein they were created?
19. What is the misery of that estate whereinto man fell?
A River of Life
sermons.description: Art insists that the waters of life flowing from the Throne are available here and now for those who are yielded to that Throne and to that Lordship. As believers, why are so few of us accessing that life? Could it be we are not yielded to the totality of that Lordship?
sermons.preacher_description:
Art Katz (1929 â€“ 2007)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Art Katz in mp3 format. He was radically converted by reading the New Testament. God used him to have a powerful prophetic insight into the end-times and the coming suffering of the jewish people before the great accepting of Jesus as Messiah. His eschatological insight is a very needful truth to be realized in the body of Christ. 

Art was a prophetic voice insofar as he called his listeners to purposes in God that would affect both time and eternity, purposes that had to do with the glory of God in the Church.   Frequently, his messages called the Church to an awareness of the Last Days [End-times] in such a way that made that time seem imminent and at the door.

sermons.title: Be Ye Perfect
sermons.description: A revelation of the difference between the perfect and its enemy—the humanly conceived good. This is a challenge to live by a Higher Standard, His heavenly Life, in a world and a church that applauds the merely ‘good.’
sermons.preacher_description:
Art Katz (1929 â€“ 2007)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Art Katz in mp3 format. He was radically converted by reading the New Testament. God used him to have a powerful prophetic insight into the end-times and the coming suffering of the jewish people before the great accepting of Jesus as Messiah. His eschatological insight is a very needful truth to be realized in the body of Christ. 

Art was a prophetic voice insofar as he called his listeners to purposes in God that would affect both time and eternity, purposes that had to do with the glory of God in the Church.   Frequently, his messages called the Church to an awareness of the Last Days [End-times] in such a way that made that time seem imminent and at the door.

sermons.title: Christ the Man #1
sermons.description: Christ’s death—incredible;  Christ’s resurrection—impossible! We are reminded here that God looks at the heart. An overall view of the lives and times of Mary and Joseph and prophecy being fulfilled.  Summing all up with God wants 100%, ALL of us.
sermons.preacher_description:
Major Ian Thomas (1914 – 2007)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Major Ian Thomas in mp3 format. Evangelical writer, theological teacher and founder of the Torchbearers bible schools. These schools are now world-wide in many countries and provide a teaching base on the person of Christ in the believer and basic Biblical exposition of Bible books.

Among the many books that he wrote, the most influential have been: "The Saving Life Of Christ" , "The mystery of godliness" and "If I perish, I Perish." His burden in ministry was to express and show the indwelling life of Christ in believers and the rest and power that life will have in us as we trust and have faith.

sermons.title: Holiness and Temptation
sermons.description: Temptaion is the main  point in this sermon. in which the speaker deals with how should a christian guard against tempation and the different methods the devil use to bring a man under tempatation's spell.

sermons.title: How Satan Destroys a Church - Part 2 (HOW SATAN DESTROYS BY DIVIDING)
sermons.description: Satan seeks to destroy the church by dividing us from God and each other.  Rebellion against authority by anyone can bring destruction.  In the home the husband can lose his leadership by not loving his wife as instructed in Ephesians 5 and his wife will greatly suffer by his lack of love and the end result will be division in the home.
sermons.preacher_description:
Don Courville ( - )
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Don Courville in mp3 format. Brother Don has been involved in the work of revival for many years. He was involved in the Nebraska revival in the 1980's and had a radio program that aired in the mid-western United States. He has been involved in church plants and works of the Lord where great unity of faith was expressed.
Currently he is pastoring the Maranatha Baptist Church in Missouri and running a annual Family Camp where Keith Daniel is the keynote speaker. He also arranges Keith Daniels annual tour of the USA. Brother Don has been a moderator for many SermonIndex Revival Conferences across the world and has a great heart for genuine revival in our day.

sermons.title: Joy out of Travail
sermons.preacher_description:
T. Austin Sparks (1888 â€“ 1971)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker T. Austin Sparks in mp3 format. He was ordained as a Baptist pastor at the age of 24, and from 1912 to 1926 led three congregations in Greater London. During these years, he was also closely related to Jessie Penn-Lewis and her publication and speaking ministry, the "Overcomer Testimony."

Among the many books that he wrote, at least three are regarded as Christian classics: The School of Christ, The Centrality and Supremacy of the Lord Jesus Christ and We Beheld His Glory. The primary theme of Sparks' books is the exaltation of the Lord Jesus Christ. He mentored Watchman Nee for many years and was very influential in his understanding of the Church Life.

sermons.title: Nakedness & the Holiness of God
sermons.description: We were created perfect in a perfect world. Adam and Eve rebelled against God's rule, which resulted in sin, shame, and nakedness. Ever since, we have been trying to cover our nakedness and hide our true selves from God, ourselves, and other people. We can never adequately deal with our nakedness, but God has come into our wrecked world to provide a perfect cover for us.
sermons.preacher_description:
Tim Keller ( - )
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Tim Keller in mp3 format.  Is an American Christian apologist, author, speaker, and the founding pastor of Redeemer Presbyterian Church in New York City, New York. He is the author of several books, including The Reason for God: Belief in an Age of Skepticism, which garnered awards from World Magazine and Christianity Today and was No. 7 on The New York Times Best Seller list for non-fiction in March 2008.
He was ordained by the Presbyterian Church in America (PCA) and served as a pastor in Virginia for nine years, while serving as director of church planting for the PCA. He also served on the faculty of Westminster Theological Seminary, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, where he and his wife Kathy were involved in urban ministry and he continues as an adjunct professor of practical theology. Keller is a co-founder of The Gospel Coalition, a group of Reformed leaders from around the United States.

sermons.title: Redeemed from the Curse of the Law
sermons.description: This truth is one of the foundations of our faith in receiving blessing from the Lord. Some have called this truth the believer's Emancipation Proclamation.
sermons.preacher_description:
Paris Reidhead (1919 - 1992)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Paris Reidhead in mp3 format. Was a Christian missionary, teacher, writer, and advocate of economic development in impoverished nations. A spiritual crisis during this period—as he described two decades later in what is probably his best-known recorded teaching, "Ten Shekels and a Shirt"--left Reidhead with the conviction that much of evangelicalism had adopted utilitarian and humanistic philosophies contradictory to Biblical teaching. The end of all being, he came to believe, was not the happiness of man, but the glorification of God. This theme would recur throughout his later teaching.

Since Mr. Reidhead's death in 1992, Bible Teaching Ministries, Inc. continues under the leadership of his wife, Marjorie, and daughter, Virginia Teitt, a dedicated Board, and the many people who have donated time and talent after being changed by God’s Word through this message. The message of the Gospel is reaching an ever-widening audience all over the world.

sermons.title: Religiosity or Spirituality #2 - The Two Streams
sermons.description: When Adam fell, he not only gained a gravitation towards sin but also towards being religious.  Brother Zac contrasts these two streams--religiosity vs. spirituality--as it threads its way through the Bible, starting with Cain and Abel, to the Pharisees and Jesus, to the end times in Revelation with Babylon and Jerusalem.  Externally these can appear so similar, but the underlying spirit is as different as heaven is from hell.
sermons.preacher_description:
Zac Poonen ( - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Zac Poonen in mp3 format. God called brother Zac Poonen to a new work early on in his Christian experience. He clearly and passionately shares the  narrow way of Christian discipleship that is neglected by so many modern preachers.

sermons.title: Spiritual Deception
sermons.description: Deception is mostly truth but has just a little bit to turn one off to the side.  We as true believers can be led away by subtle things, building upon things that God never intended as “building blocks”.  Jesus Christ must be the supreme Person we focus upon and talk about, not things.   This brother shares personal testimonies of God moving in everyday life that illustrate his passion--the centrality of Christ.

sermons.title: The Gospel Of The Devil! Believe It Not
sermons.preacher_description:
Ian Paisley (1926 - 2014)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Ian Paisley in mp3 format. Founder of the Free Presbyterian Movement with over 100 churches world-wide and bible colleges. This presbyterian renewal movement was started in light of compromise and apostasy in existing churches in Ireland, Scotland and England. These churches are clear biblical churches with a clear emphasis on preaching the Gospel of Jesus Christ and His death for sinners.
Ian Paisley also has been active in politics for many years and a leader of a political party. Leonard Ravenhill commented once that the Lord could have used paisley in a powerful way like Whitfield if he stayed away from politics. His preaching is expositional and biblical from a burdened heart to represent His Lord well.

sermons.title: There were two trees in the Garden - Part 2
sermons.description: If the Tree of Life was as equally accessible to Adam and Eve, why did they scorn and reject that tree, and prefer instead to eat from the Tree of the Knowledge of Good and Evil? Is the Tree of Life equally unattractive today, and why are we disposed to the thing that seems outwardly attractive? With an introduction on the ‘cleaving’ of man to woman.
sermons.preacher_description:
Art Katz (1929 â€“ 2007)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Art Katz in mp3 format. He was radically converted by reading the New Testament. God used him to have a powerful prophetic insight into the end-times and the coming suffering of the jewish people before the great accepting of Jesus as Messiah. sermons.title: Why Must We Be Spiritually Ready?
sermons.preacher_description:
Stephen Kaung ( - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Stephen Kaung in mp3 format. Stephen Kaung is a Chinese Chrisitan speaker and writer, and now living in Richmond, Virgina. At an early age was converted to Christianity and was active in the Methodist Church in China, with home his father was a minister. He first met watchman need in the early 1930's and joined Nee's indigenous christian work full-time, working with him until 1949 when he left China and became involved with Christian work in other ares of the Far East.

Stephen Kaung worked very closely with T Austin-Sparks until his death in 1972. His burden has been to allow a testimony of the Lord in the local assembly, and to help the saints see the great importance of the Church as God intended it. Stephen Kaung's major work has been to translate the writings of Watchman Nee into English, over 50 titles which have been published by his own organisation, Christian Fellowship Publishers (CFP), In Richmond, Virgina.
